More people are studying English. English is spoken in many countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. Native speakers do not decide how many people learn a language. Many people learn a language when it is spoken in many countries.

Two men look north. The land stretches far. Fences are not visible in the distance. A teenage boy cannot leave. Sam sees a big animal. The boy might ride it, and then there could be a problem. But if the boy doesn't know about animals, there will be even more difficulty. The boy's father is with him.

NASA has a plan. This plan aims to stop a big rock from hitting Earth. The plan is called Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response, or HAMMER for short. They want to shoot big rockets at the rock to change its course. If the rock gets too close, they will use a bomb to disintegrate it. This will make the rock move away. It will prevent it from hitting us. NASA is very thinking about this idea.

I am part of a group. We want to stop machines that kill on their own. Don't think about movies showing this. Instead, think about what's happening now. Military machines like remote-controlled planes and automated guns are already used to kill. They do this with little human help. Soon, there will be robots that kill on their own. This would be very wrong and dangerous for us. We must be careful when we ask machines to do things.

In old scary movies, heroes can't call for help. They also can't call the police. Now, phones seem unbelievable. To keep suspense, phones don't work. If you're a hero in a scary movie, your phone doesn't work. Or, your phone runs out of power just as you're calling for help. Sometimes, both happen - your phone stops working and you can't call for help.

Auggie goes to school. On his first day, he feels very worried. He looks different, so kids don't want to sit near him. They watch or talk about him. Luckily, he meets Jack and Summer, who become his friends. But it's hard for Auggie. Other kids think he's sick and won't touch him. During the year, sometimes he feels good, sometimes he feels bad. At a school camp, something unusual happens, which changes everything.

Over 4,000 people have climbed Mount Everest. They range in age from 13 to 80. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, a woman from Austria, started climbing mountains when she was young. After finishing school, she worked as a nurse but continued climbing in her free time. Climbing high mountains in cold, stormy weather is very dangerous. However, top climbers look for new challenges when they reach the summit. Their ages affect the challenges they seek; older climbers may look for easier tasks, while younger ones seek more difficult ones.

Gabriela speaks to her team. She asks about their thoughts. The team says they are not used to orders. They prefer to have more ideas and be creative. They think Gabriela does not trust them. They were trying to make changes. Gabriela feels sad about this. They explain their ways of working to her.

Faith47 comes from Cape Town. She paints big, colorful pictures. Her paintings have people and animals in them. She likes to look around and find new places. She paints on streets, in old factories, and on old cars. Street art is not lasting. It changes because of weather and cleaners.

The two men looked north. The land is vast. It's hard to see all of it at once. The fences look far away. A teen might want to run away, but it's difficult on foot. There's no shelter nearby. Sam looked at the biggest horse, stamping the ground. He thought: Can the boy ride? There's trouble out here. It's far from help. But if the boy can't ride, there's more danger. He wants to escape to the north, towards the northern end of the property. His knowledge of horses might help him escape if he can ride well.

Every day is not always good. Sometimes it is not. Progress is not easy. Steven Pinker says good news. People live longer now. They are healthier. They are happier. People attack reason and understanding. This is a problem. Bad people say bad things. They cause big problems. When people attack Enlightenment values, important things are hurt. These include democracy and world teamwork. We live longer, healthier, happier lives because of these values. If we lose them, we will have many problems.

According to Campbell, the hero has started by saying 'no'. The invitation was important. Then, a wise teacher came along to help. They were deciding to enter a special world where the adventure was happening. Next, the hero faced tests and fought enemies, making new friends along the way. They were getting ready for their biggest challenge. For Luke, his teacher was Obi-Wan, who was a wise teacher. His friends were Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO, who helped him. The enemy was Darth Vader, who was a powerful villain. The special world was the Death Star, where the final battle took place.
